title: Guardians of the Rift/Strategies

properties.name: description
properties.value: Although the Guardians of the Rift minigame can be completed with varying levels and equipment, the general strategy remains consistent. Those without access to the larger essence pouches may have to convert more guardian essence and make more frequent trips through the runic altars.

content:
Although the Guardians of the Rift minigame can be completed with varying levels and equipment, the general strategy remains consistent. Those without access to the larger essence pouches may have to convert more guardian essence and make more frequent trips through the runic altars.

Contents

  • 1 General tips
  • 2 Recommended equipment
    • 2.1 Inventory
  • 3 General Strategy
    • 3.1 Step-By-Step
    • 3.2 Additional notes
  • 4 Advanced Strategies
    • 4.1 Optimized Strategy (Mass world)

General tips[edit | edit source]

  • If a barrier breaks, the Great Guardian's power will rapidly drop, especially at later stages. Prioritize repairing them as soon as possible.
  • Avoid using weaker cells for guardians, as the lower damage output will result in more abyssal creatures, and require more attention to barriers.
  • Points/xp are based on the amount of essence crafted, not the tier of the altar, so it is not efficient to wait for certain altars to become active.
  • With a set-up that allows staying inside the barrier, the time between rounds can be spent using weak cells to craft guardians for additional crafting/runecrafting xp.
  • When building a barrier at the start of a game, stand on the barrier side of the cell tile. This will knock your character through the barrier after it's built, giving you a head start at running to a mining spot.
  • Crafting combination runes now produces polyelemental guardian stones, giving an additional point per. With magic imbue and binding necklaces this can result in up to 50% more elemental points, at the cost of some inventory space, more attention, and the above requirements.

Recommended equipment[edit | edit source]

SlotItem (most effective → least effective)
Hat of the eyeGraceful hood[1]N/A
Max cape/Runecraft capeGraceful cape[1]Spottier cape/Spotted cape
Robe top of the eyeVarrock armour[2]Graceful top[1]
Robe bottoms of the eyeGraceful legs[1]N/A
Crystal pickaxe[3]Dragon pickaxeRune pickaxe
Abyssal lantern (redwood logs)[4]Abyssal lantern (yew logs)/Abyssal lantern (oak logs)[5]Abyssal lantern (magic logs)[6]/Abyssal lantern (blisterwood logs)[7]
Graceful gloves[1]N/AN/A
Boots of the eyeGraceful boots[1]Boots of lightness
Celestial ring/Celestial signet[8]Ring of enduranceN/A
  1. ↑ 1.0 1.1 1.2 1.3 1.4 1.5 Graceful is only useful at low Agility levels or with a small team.
  2. ↑ 10% chance of mining 2 Guardian fragments or Guardian essence
  3. ↑ A Crystal pickaxe is fastest, but will rapidly drain charges.
  4. ↑ Without 99 Runecrafting or if not using NPC Contact.
  5. ↑ For maximum points.
  6. ↑ 10% increase to runes crafted.
  7. ↑ 20% increase to blood runes crafted.
  8. ↑ If using Crystal pickaxe.

Inventory[edit | edit source]

  • A chisel if assembling rune guardians.
  • Essence pouches up to your available Runecraft level.
    • Upgrade to the colossal pouch once you acquire the abyssal needle and have level 85 Runecraft alongside 56 Crafting.
  • A rune pouch for the NPC Contact spell to repair pouches (requires access to the Lunar spellbook and 67+ Magic.)
    • Can also be used to store runes if players have a means to stop pouch decay, such as an abyssal lantern (redwood logs) or a runecraft cape.

General Strategy[edit | edit source]

This strategy allows upwards of 8 points, split between elemental and catalytic, with a colossal pouch and slightly less for other set-ups.

Overview (in seconds)
Time Phase
-30 take a weak cell and several uncharged
0 Round begins; create barrier/guardian
15 Reach remains, begin mining
85 Stop mining, begin crafting essence (~120 frags)
135 Second altar rotation; use altar
160 First portal spawns; mine until full
190 Redeem stones/cell, then use altar
220 Deposit runes, craft essence
290 Redeem stones/cell, then use altar
320 Second portal spawns
350 Redeem stones/cell, then use altar
380 Deposit runes, craft essence
450 Redeem stones/cell, then use altar
480 Third portal spawns[1]
etc Repeat as necessary until round end.

Step-By-Step[edit | edit source]

Before the start of the round, grab a weak cell and 5-10 uncharged cells

  1. Create barriers if needed, or a guardian if others are at cell tiles
  2. Run down the east slope to the large remains
  3. Mine between 140-180 fragments[2]
  4. Craft essence until the second altar rotation, then use an altar
  5. Go through the portal and mine your maximum
  6. Redeem your stones and charged cell[3]
  7. Use an altar, redeem stones/cell, and deposit runes
  8. Craft ~40 essence, then use another altar
  9. Repeat the steps in bold until the round is complete.[1]
  1. ↑ 1.0 1.1 With a sizable team and good efficiency, you should have time for three portal trips.
  2. ↑ Fewer are possible if you have good timing with portals and large team sizes.
  3. ↑ Recharge a barrier, or make a guardian if they are few.

Between rounds, take runes from the bank to cast NPC Contact and repair your pouches as needed. Those with a lantern lit with redwood logs, or without any pouches, can remain inside the barrier. A rune pouch with the necessary runes can achieve the same result, at the cost of an inventory slot.

Additional notes[edit | edit source]

  • The initial altar timing varies, but portal timing is consistent every 160 seconds.
  • The unbolded lines are based on a 50s crafting window and 70s initial mining window
    • This is achievable with huge/colossal pouches and rune/dragon pickaxes.
  • If you find yourself running out of essence, mine for longer and craft less before the 135 altar.
  • On more populated worlds, the timing after the third portal can be tight; consider mining less to ensure you can redeem some stones.

Advanced Strategies[edit | edit source]

Optimized Strategy (Mass world)[edit | edit source]

This strategy assumes the usage of a Colossal pouch and should guarantee 8+ points, catalytic and elemental combined, every round depending how fast you are.

Before rift opens:

  1. Repair pouches with NPC Contact spell[1]
  2. Grab 10 uncharged cells
  3. Grab 1 weak cell
  4. Wait by empty cell tiles or by a guardian if you have a chisel[2]
  1. ↑ If not using an Abyssal lantern (redwood logs) or a Runecrafting cape.
  2. ↑ Can skip steps 3 and 4 if your team is already building all available barriers and creating enough guardians.

Rift opens (game starts):

  1. Build a barrier or create a guardian with the weak cell
  2. Run to the Large Guardian Remains on the eastern side of the arena
  3. Mine 165-170 essence fragments[1]
  4. Craft 30 essence and go to altar and craft runes -> Exit altar
  5. Power-up and heal barrier[2] + Deposit Runes if needed
  6. Go to portal -> Mine full inventory + fill colossal pouch
  7. Go to altar and craft runes -> Exit altar
  8. Craft full inventory of essence fragments + fill colossal pouch
  9. Power-up and heal barrier + Deposit Runes if needed
  10. Go to altar and craft runes -> Exit altar
  11. Power-up and heal barrier + Deposit Runes if needed
  12. Go to portal -> Mine full inventory + fill colossal pouch
  13. Go to altar and craft runes -> Exit altar
  14. Power-up and heal barrier + Deposit Runes if needed
  15. Craft remaining essence fragments until portal pops
  16. Go to portal -> Mine until Great Guardian is at 91%-92%[3]
  17. Go to altar and craft runes -> Exit altar
  18. Power-up and heal barrier
  19. Done
  1. ↑ Go for 165 essence fragments when you have to build a west side barrier.
  2. ↑ Crafting an overcharged guardian is also an option if there are less than 10 guardians in play.
  3. ↑ It is very difficult to craft runes and power-up the Great Guardian after 92%.

rawContent:
Although the [[Guardians of the Rift]] minigame can be completed with varying levels and equipment, the general strategy remains consistent. Those without access to the larger essence pouches may have to convert more guardian essence and make more frequent trips through the runic altars.

==General tips==
* If a barrier breaks, the Great Guardian's power will rapidly drop, especially at later stages. Prioritize repairing them as soon as possible.
* Avoid using weaker cells for guardians, as the lower damage output will result in more abyssal creatures, and require more attention to barriers.
* Points/xp are based on the amount of essence crafted, not the tier of the altar, so it is not efficient to wait for certain altars to become active.
* With a set-up that allows staying inside the barrier, the time between rounds can be spent using weak cells to craft guardians for additional crafting/runecrafting xp.
* When building a barrier at the start of a game, stand on the barrier side of the cell tile. This will knock your character through the barrier after it's built, giving you a head start at running to a mining spot.
* Crafting [[combination runes]] now produces [[polyelemental guardian stone]]s, giving an additional point per. With [[magic imbue]] and [[binding necklace]]s this can result in up to 50% more elemental points, at the cost of some inventory space, more attention, and the above requirements.

==Recommended equipment==
{{Recommended equipment
|helm1 = {{plink|Hat of the eye|pic=Hat of the eye (all colors)|gif=yes}}|helm2 ={{plink|Graceful hood}}<ref name="grace">Graceful is only useful at low Agility levels or with a small team.</ref>
|cape1 = {{plink|Max cape}}/{{plink|Runecraft cape}}|cape2 ={{plink|Graceful cape}}<ref name="grace"></ref>|cape3 ={{plink|Spottier cape}}/{{plink|Spotted cape}}
|body1 = {{plink|Robe top of the eye|pic=Robe top of the eye (all colors)|gif=yes}}|body2={{plink|Varrock armour|pic=Varrock armour 2}}<ref>10% chance of mining 2 Guardian fragments or Guardian essence</ref>
|body3 = {{plink|Graceful top}}<ref name="grace"></ref>
|legs1 = {{plink|Robe bottoms of the eye|pic=Robe bottoms of the eye (all colors)|gif=yes}}|legs2 ={{plink|Graceful legs}}<ref name="grace"></ref>
|weapon1 = {{plink|Crystal pickaxe}}<ref>A [[Crystal pickaxe]] is fastest, but will rapidly drain charges.</ref>|weapon2 ={{plink|Dragon pickaxe}}|weapon3 ={{plink|Rune pickaxe}}
|shield1 = {{plink|Abyssal lantern (redwood logs)}}<ref>Without 99 Runecrafting or if not using NPC Contact.</ref>
|shield2 = {{plink|Abyssal lantern (yew logs)}}/{{plink|Abyssal lantern (oak logs)}}<ref>For maximum points.</ref>
|shield3 = {{plink|Abyssal lantern (magic logs)}}<ref>10% increase to runes crafted.</ref>/{{plink|Abyssal lantern (blisterwood logs)}}<ref>20% increase to blood runes crafted.</ref>
|hands1 = {{plink|Graceful gloves}}<ref name="grace"></ref>
|boots1 = {{plink|Boots of the eye}}|boots2 ={{plink|Graceful boots}}<ref name="grace"></ref>|boots3 ={{plink|Boots of lightness}}
|ring1 = {{plink|Celestial ring}}/{{plink|Celestial signet}}<ref>If using Crystal pickaxe.</ref>|ring2 ={{plink|Ring of endurance}}
}}
<references />

===Inventory===
{{Inventory
|align = right
|1 = Giant pouch
|2 = Large pouch
|3 = Chisel
|4 = Rune pouch
|5 = Small pouch
|6 = Medium pouch
}}
{{Rune pouch|Air rune|Cosmic rune|Astral rune
| align = right
}}
* A [[chisel]] if assembling rune guardians.
* [[Essence pouch]]es up to your available [[Runecraft]] level.
** Upgrade to the [[colossal pouch]] once you acquire the [[abyssal needle]] and have level 85 Runecraft alongside 56 Crafting.
* A [[rune pouch]] for the [[NPC Contact]] spell to repair pouches (requires access to the [[Lunar spellbook]] and 67+ Magic.)
** Can also be used to store runes if players have a means to stop pouch decay, such as an [[abyssal lantern (redwood logs)]] or a [[runecraft cape]].

==General Strategy==
This strategy allows upwards of 8 points, split between elemental and catalytic, with a [[colossal pouch]] and slightly less for other set-ups.
{| class="wikitable"
|+ Overview (in seconds) 
|-
! Time !! !! Phase
|-
| ''-30'' ||[[File:Uncharged cell.png]]|| take a weak cell and several uncharged
|-
| '''0''' ||[[File:Weak cell.png]]|| '''Round begins'''; create barrier/guardian
|-
| 15 ||[[File:Mining icon.png]]|| Reach remains, begin mining
|-
| 85 ||[[File:Crafting icon.png]]|| Stop mining, begin crafting essence (~120 frags)
|-
| '''135''' ||[[File:Runecraft icon.png]]|| '''Second altar rotation'''; use altar
|-
| '''160''' ||[[File:Mining icon.png]]|| '''First portal spawns'''; mine until full
|-
| 190 ||[[File:Runecraft icon.png]]|| Redeem stones/cell, then use altar
|-
| 220 ||[[File:Crafting icon.png]]|| Deposit runes, craft essence
|-

|-

| etc || || Repeat as necessary until round end.

===Step-By-Step===
Before the start of the round, grab a weak cell and 5-10 uncharged cells
# Create barriers if needed, or a guardian if others are at cell tiles
# Run down the east slope to the large remains
# Mine between 140-180 fragments<ref name="frags">Fewer are possible if you have good timing with portals and large team sizes.</ref>
# Craft essence until ''the second altar rotation'', then use an altar
# '''Go through the portal and mine your maximum'''
# '''Redeem your stones and charged cell'''<ref name="redeem">Recharge a barrier, or make a guardian if they are few.</ref>
# '''Use an altar, redeem stones/cell, and deposit runes'''
# '''Craft ~40 essence, then use another altar'''
# Repeat the steps in bold until the round is complete.<ref name="repetitions">With a sizable team and good efficiency, you should have time for three portal trips.</ref>
<references />

Between rounds, take runes from the bank to cast NPC Contact and repair your pouches as needed. Those with a lantern lit with redwood logs, or without any pouches, can remain inside the barrier. A rune pouch with the necessary runes can achieve the same result, at the cost of an inventory slot.

===Additional notes===
*The initial altar timing varies, but portal timing is consistent every 160 seconds.
*The unbolded lines are based on a 50s crafting window and 70s initial mining window
**This is achievable with huge/colossal pouches and rune/dragon pickaxes.
*If you find yourself running out of essence, mine for longer and craft less before the 135 altar.
*On more populated worlds, the timing after the third portal can be tight; consider mining less to ensure you can redeem some stones.

==Advanced Strategies==
===Optimized Strategy (Mass world)===
This strategy assumes the usage of a [[Colossal pouch]] and should guarantee 8+ points, catalytic and elemental combined, every round depending how fast you are.

Before rift opens:

# Repair pouches with [[NPC Contact]] spell<ref name="repair">If not using an [[Abyssal lantern (redwood logs)]] or a [[Runecrafting cape]].</ref>
# Grab 10 uncharged cells
# Grab 1 weak cell
# Wait by empty cell tiles or by a guardian if you have a chisel<ref name="beforeRiftSkip">Can skip steps 3 and 4 if your team is already building all available barriers and creating enough guardians.</ref>
<references />

Rift opens (game starts):

# Build a barrier or create a guardian with the weak cell
#Run to the Large Guardian Remains on the eastern side of the arena
# Mine 165-170 essence fragments<ref name="fragOptimized">Go for 165 essence fragments when you have to build a west side barrier.</ref>
# Craft 30 essence and go to altar and craft runes -> Exit altar
# Power-up and heal barrier<ref name="overchargedGuard">Crafting an overcharged guardian is also an option if there are less than 10 guardians in play.</ref> + Deposit Runes ''if needed''
# Go to portal -> Mine full inventory + fill colossal pouch
# Go to altar and craft runes -> Exit altar
# Craft full inventory of essence fragments + fill colossal pouch
# Power-up and heal barrier + Deposit Runes ''if needed''
# Go to altar and craft runes -> Exit altar
# Power-up and heal barrier + Deposit Runes ''if needed''
# Go to portal -> Mine full inventory + fill colossal pouch
# Go to altar and craft runes -> Exit altar
# Power-up and heal barrier + Deposit Runes ''if needed''
# Craft remaining essence fragments until portal pops
# Go to portal -> Mine until Great Guardian is at 91%-92%<ref name="percent">It is very difficult to craft runes and power-up the Great Guardian after 92%.</ref>
# Go to altar and craft runes -> Exit altar
# Power-up and heal barrier
# Done
<references />
